Grouped_Utterances: I’ve been doing okay. I tried journaling once, but I didn’t keep up with it. I felt a bit awkward at first, but it was nice to get my thoughts out. I think I just got busy and forgot about it. Yes, I’ve been doing it in the mornings. It really helps me start my day off right. I feel more centered and less anxious, especially when I start my day with it. Sometimes I still find my mind wandering, but I try to bring it back. I did it! It felt good to acknowledge those memories. It felt cathartic. I cried a little, but I also felt a sense of closure. I think I’m starting to accept that it’s over. I want to focus on myself more and maybe explore new hobbies. I feel hopeful. It’s nice to have something to look forward to. I’ve been thinking about my job search again. I feel like I’m not making progress. I’ve applied to a couple more jobs, but I haven’t heard back yet.
I found a few online, and I think I’ll sign up for one next week!

One technique is to focus on your senses. For example, when you’re outside, take a moment to notice what you see, hear, and feel. It can help ground you in the present moment.  Networking doesn’t have to be intimidating. You could start by sending a friendly message to someone you know, asking how they’ve been and if they have any advice.
Great! Let’s check in about that in our next session. Remember, it’s all about taking small steps.
